snippet: As of Jan. 1, the authorities will limit the use of private cars in the Indian capital to every other day, depending on whether a vehicle’s license plate ends in an even or odd number.
abstract: Delhi chief secretary K K Sharma announces anti-pollution plan to restrict private cars on streets of city based on whether their license plates end in odd or even numbers will be implemented starting in 2016; notes restrictions will be temporary and public transportation will be increased; air quality in city is rated 'hazardous' by World Health Organization.
lead_paragraph: As of Jan. 1, the authorities will limit the use of private cars in the Indian capital to every other day, depending on whether a vehicle’s license plate ends in an even or odd number.

headline.main: Delhi to Limit Use of Cars in an Effort to Control Pollution
headline.print_headline: Delhi Announces Driving Restrictions to Mitigate Its Air Pollution
